item.title: Most of Hartley Lane has numerous potholes, particularly around the quarry entrance, but also right up to the top car park. The sides of the road are also very band. The surface is breaking up from the edges, narrowing the road surface. Pretty dangerous now., 22nd December
item.description:
Mainly on the road 200 yds either side of the entrance to the old quarry and ALSO the actual access entrance to the quarry
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Coberley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: From 19 December, 10-12 trees are being felled at the end of School Lane on the Highway. There was no prior warning given to residents and no safety measures in place. The workmen seem to be encroaching on private land adjacent to the Highway. Please can you send an officer to view the site asap and confirm whether legal permissions for the work have been granted., 22nd December
item.description:
The problem starts outside New Haven (now Phoenix Meadow) on School Lane and extends to the start of the footpath at Betty Robertâ€™s Lane. This section is officially Highway ref 4111.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road flooding due to blocked drains, 22nd December
item.description:
Despite a brief downpour, the road is flooded on the corner of Queens Road and Christ Church Road GL50 2LR. The issue has been ongoing for the past 3 years at least, even though the road surface being relayed relatively recently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The white paint has been washed away, 22nd December
item.description:
Someone came out and put white paint around the potholes to be repaired between Dark Lane and Oakland Farm but this paint has been washed away before any repairs could be carried out. The rain has caused further deterioration to these and other potholes/road subsidence on the lane with further potholes requiring repair besides those reported under : Web ref. Enq No 6854998. 22064937 6854945. 22064936 6854868. 22064934 6854839. 22064932 Rather than keeping submitting additional reports could the lane be thoroughly assessed and proper appropriate lasting repair work done to all the potholes to prevent having to continuously submit reports requiring multiple visits by your repair team as this seems such a waste of your resources and taxpayers money.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, 22nd December
item.description:
The tree is located along the bridal path at the back of Greenwood Drive and is hanging over the garden of number 12 (the last house whose garden backs onto it as you come down the path from the main road). Has been present for 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury

item.title: Blocked drain, 22nd December
item.description:
The drain is between no 25 and no25A Hillview Road. This drain has never been looked at but it is always full of water and with the recent down pours the pool of water when we have heavy downpours is starting to come down my driveway. Could this please be cleaned out ASAP. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillview Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light Out (again), 21st December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Roberts Road, Noverton, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken pedestrian crossing sensor causing needless red lights on Benhall sliproad, 21st December
item.description:
Pedestrian sensor is broken, missing cover, exposed wiring and electronics causing the lights to repeatedly turn red causing delays on the bus lane and slip road to Benhall - as well as delaying A40 Westbound.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Lights are red for no reason
